p:
Arsenic, a naturally forming element that often occurs in combination with sulfur and other metals, is an environmental contaminant found in drinking water
9 . The WHO and the International Agency for Research on Cancer categorize inorganic arsenic as carcinogenic, and provisional guidelines recommend a concentration below 10 μg/L
10 . However, it has been reported that about 50 countries around the world have drinking water with concentrations of inorganic arsenic over the recommended level
11, 12 . Exposure to inorganic arsenic over a prolonged period of time is reportedly linked to the occurrence of skin, bladder, and lung cancer
13, 14 .
